result.execSummary:
The defendant Brenda J McMorris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Successfully complete Drug Treatment Court.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

*CO-SIGNATURE BOND WITH VERONICA MCMORRIS, DOB: 3-09-1977. Charges per attached criminal complaint. CONDITIONS: Attend meetings, comply with terms of probation, no contact with Pearle Vision except for restitution purposes, make all medical appointments, continue to attend the WOW Program and must comply with a 10:00 pm curfew. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780) after being released and after every court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
